channel.title: Upgrading on DefectDojo Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Upgrading on DefectDojo Documentation

item.title: Upgrading Guide
item.description: Docker compose When you deploy a vanilla docker compose, it will create a persistent volume for your Postgres database. As long as your volume is there, you should not lose any data.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.44.0
item.description: Hash Code changes The Burp parser now has a custom deduplication configuration to make deduplication more accurate. To recalculate the hash code and deduplicate existing Burp findings, please execute the following command:

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.44.1
item.description: AWS Parser Endpoint Migrations The structure of AWS Endpoints changed slightly. In the past ARNs of Services were imported with invalid digits leading to broken Endpoints.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.43.x
item.description: Audit log migration As part of the upgrade to django-auditlog 3.x, there is a migration of existing records from json-text to json.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.42.x
item.description: Hash Code changes A few parsers have been updated to populate more fields. Some of these fields are part of the hash code calculation.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.41.x
item.description: There are no special instructions for upgrading to 2.41.x. Check the Release Notes for the contents of the release.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.40.x
item.description: With the upgrade to Django 5.1.x, Posgres 12 will no longer be supported. Please make plans to upgrade to a later version of Postrges before upgrading to version 2.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.39.x
item.description: There are no special instructions for upgrading to 2.39.x. Check the Release Notes for the contents of the release.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.38.x
item.description: Breaking Change Previous HELM values.yaml file was not following the official HELM best practicies on key naming - https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/values/#naming-conventions The following snake_case keys are replaced with camelCase keys in the values.

item.title: Upgrading to DefectDojo Version 2.37.x
item.description: Breaking Change Support for MySQL and RabbitMQ was previously deprecated see discussion post here) and is now being removed MySQL and RabbitMQ have been removed from the following places:
